Generation III.Ruby: All the Spinda that exist in the world are said to have utterly unique spot patterns. The shaky, tottering steps of this Pok é mon give it the appearance of dancing.
Generation III.Sapphire: No two Spinda are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This Pok é mon moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.
Generation III.Emerald: It is distinguished by a pattern of spots that is always different. Its unsteady, tottering walk has the effect of fouling its foe's aim.
Generation III.FireRed: No two Spinda are said to have identical patterns. It confuses foes with its stumbling motions.
Generation III.LeafGreen: No two Spinda are said to have identical patterns. It confuses foes with its stumbling motions.

Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: No two Spinda are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This Pokémon moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.

Generation VII.Sun: Its steps are staggering and unsteady, but Spinda thinks it's walking in a straight line.
Generation VII.Moon: Each and every Spinda has a slightly different configuration of spots. There are collectors who enjoy the tiny differences in their spot patterns.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its steps are shaky and stumbling. Walking for a long time makes it feel sick.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Each Spinda's spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents' attacks brilliantly!
